# The Sequential Types Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Sequential types represents &quot;arrays&quot; of types. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Sequential types represents &quot;arrays&quot; of types.

This is a super class for array, vector, and pointer types.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### LLVMArrayType() {#gabd1666e080f693e1af0b4018005cd927}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMTypeRef LLVMArrayType (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> ElementType, unsigned ElementCount)</>}>
Create a fixed size array type that refers to a specific type.

The created type will exist in the context that its element type exists in.


<XrefSect
  title="Deprecated"
  permalink="/docs/api/pages/deprecated/#_deprecated000001">
LLVMArrayType is deprecated in favor of the API accurate LLVMArrayType2
</XrefSect>
<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arraytype/#a309fed0882f9d27038ff2df2afed7a00">llvm::ArrayType::get()</a>
</SectionUser>

### LLVMPointerTypeIsOpaque() {#ga69ab8cf508533bd72c15c260909113d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMBool LLVMPointerTypeIsOpaque (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> Ty)</>}>

### LLVMScalableVectorType() {#gac3f357b97efc36f5eb74643e5bbe44b9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMTypeRef LLVMScalableVectorType (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab81b4df33167d47174f9b86a75e3be88">LLVMTypeRef</a> ElementType, unsigned ElementCount)</>}>
Create a vector type that contains a defined type and has a scalable number of elements.

The created type will exist in the context thats its element type exists in.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalablevectortype/#a5f6c82789f78714f2dfea41f443b99b7">llvm::ScalableVectorType::get()</a>
</SectionUser>

### LLVMVectorType() {#ga5ec731adf74fb40bc3b401956d0c6ff2}

<MemberDefinition
